business.headline: TotalEnergies pauses business with Adani Group amid bribery rowTotalEnergies has paused new financial investments in the Adani Group amid corruption allegations against Adani Green Energy executives, emphasising its zero-tolerance policy on misconduct.
Adani Green Energy shares tank 11% today. Here's why Adani Green Energy share price: Adani Green Energy shares dropped 11% after TotalEnergies made a crucial announcement during late trading hours.
Sensex, Nifty close higher amid market rally, Adani Green shares down 9% The S&P BSE Sensex added 992.84 points to end at 80,109.85, while the NSE Nfity50 gained 314.65 points to close at 24,221.90.

CNG prices hiked by Rs 2 in Mumbai, other cities; election bound-Delhi sparedPrices were hiked in Noida, Greater Noida, Ghaziabad, Gurugram and other cities but Delhi, which goes to polls in a few weeks from now, was spared.

NTPC Green Energy IPO share price: Strong debut on D-Street or muted listing? NTPC Green Energy IPO listing: Shares of NTPC Green Energy Limited are expected to make its debut on the stock exchanges on Wednesday after having been subscribed over 200%.

Adani Group shares rise for 2nd straight session: 2 reasons behind bull runAdani group stocks: Adani stocks continued their upward movement, with Adani Energy Solutions being among the top performers.
Zomato shares jump 7%, inclusion on BSE replacing JSW Steel soonZomato share price: Zomato stocks surged in early trade on Monday, mirroring the stock market rally following a major announcement.
Sensex surges 1200 points: 3 factors behind stock market rallyStock market rally: Sensex shot past the 80,000 mark, while the broader NSE Nifty climbed above 24,300, increasing investors' wealth.
Sensex jumps over 1,000 points in early trade, Nifty over 24,000Stock market rally: The S&P BSE Sensex was up 1192.49 points to 80,309.60, while the NSE Nifty50 was up 411.85 points to 24,319.10.

Enviro Infra Engineers IPO Day 2: Shoud you subscribe based on latest GMP?Enviro Infra Engineers IPO: Enviro Infra Engineers Limited is looking to raise Rs 650.43 crore through a book-building process and will close for bidding on November 26, 2024.

Amazon's quick commerce service code named Tez to challenge Blinkit, ZeptoThe move will mark Amazon's entry into the fast-growing quick commerce space in India, where competitors like Blinkit, Zepto, and Swiggy Instamart currently dominate.

NTPC Green Energy IPO allotment: Step-by-step guide to check statusNTPC Green Energy IPO allotment: The allotment for NTPC Green Energy IPO is expected to be finalised on Monday and investors and check their status on the online portals of BSE and Kfin Technologies Limited.

Zomato, RVNL, Zee, HDFC, HCL, Cochin Shipyard: Stocks to watch today Experts suggest the election outcome will boost investor confidence, especially in sectors like infrastructure, manufacturing, and urban development, which align with BJP's pro-business policies.

Adani firm downplays Kenya scrapping $736 million power deal: No material impactAdani Energy Solutions said there was "no material impact" on the company's operations after Kenya cancelled a $736 million transmission line project over Gautam Adani's indictment in a bribery case in the US.

BJP-led Mahayuti win Maharashtra: Will it lead to 'maha' rally on Dalal Street?The results of the Maharashtra assembly election, announced on Saturday, are expected to have a notable impact on the stock markets when trading resumes on Monday.

Elon Musk gets even richer after wealth hits all-time high post Trump winThe jump in Elon Musk's fortune came after Tesla shares rose 3.8% on Friday, reaching a 3.5-year closing high of $352.56 per share.

Jeff Bezos denies Musk's claim on Tesla stock advice: '100% not true'Elon Musk said on social media platform X that Bezos had advised people to sell their Tesla and SpaceX shares, predicting Donald Trump's electoral defeat.

Byju's founder told US ally to flee the US to avoid testifying: ReportThe businessman, William R. Hailer, testified before US Bankruptcy Judge John T. Dorsey, alleging that Byju Raveendran offered him a lucrative job and sent him a $10,700 plane ticket to Dubai just two days before he was scheduled to testify.

Sensex ends nearly 2,000 points higher, Nifty above 23,900A broad-based recovery in information technology (IT), financial, banking and energy stocks spearheaded the recovery. A sharp rebound in Adani Group stocks also added to the positive momentum.
Sensex surges 2,000 points, Rs 7 lakh crore added: 4 key factors behind rallyThe Sensex was up 2039.44 points to 79,195.23 at 2:57 pm, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 587.90  to 23,938.75.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Telangana won't accept Rs 100-crore Adani funding: Revanth Reddy amid criticismTelangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy said the state government did not take any funds or donations for the Young India Skill University from any organisation, including Adani Group.

What happened in Sambhal? Deadly clashes light political fireThe violent clashes in Uttar Pradesh's Sambhal have sparked a political blame game, with the BJP accusing Samajwadi Party leaders of incitement, SP chief Akhilesh Yadav alleging government orchestration.

Day 2 Live: CSK buy Anshul Kamboj, MI buy Afghan mystery spinner Allah GhazanfarIPL 2025 Mega Auction Day 2 Live: RCB make two big purchases in Bhuvneshwar Kumar and Krunal Pandya after a bidding war. Prithvi Shaw and Kane Williamson are some of the big names who have gone unsold. Faf du Plessis, Washington Sundar, and Sam Curran were bought at steal prices. There was a bidding war for South Africa all-rounder Marco Jansen. The second day of the auction is heating up.

Navjot Singh Sidhu reveals wife's doctor-approved cancer recovery dietNavjot Singh Sidhu recently announced that his wife is clinically cancer-free. She was diagnosed with stage 4 cancer, after which she underwent treatment and followed a strict diet plan.

Monk leading protest against atrocities on Hindus in Bangladesh arrested in DhakaChinmoy Prabhu, a prominent monk leading protests against atrocities on Hindus in Bangladesh, was allegedly arrested by the Dhaka Police's Detective Branch on Monday (November 25). He was allegedly detained at Dhaka airport.

Was centuries-old Sambhal temple razed? What 1875 ASI report, historians sayThe town of Sambhal in Uttar Pradesh saw violent rioting over a court-mandated survey at the Shahi Jama Masjid. The violence has roots in a dispute over the Shahi Jama Masjid, which Hindus claim was built after Babur demolished a centuries-old Kalki temple. This is what an ASI report of 1879 and historians say.

Delhi University student elections end in split victory after long delayThe DUSU poll results are out and NSUI and ABVP each won two key seats in Delhi University's long-delayed student elections, reshaping the power dynamics in DUSU amid tight security and a fierce campaign.

Corbett camera traps, drones being used to snoop on women: ExpertsCamera traps, voice recorders and drones, meant for conservation of wildlife in Corbett Tiger Reserve in Uttarakhand, are also used to snoop on village women who go into the forest for foraging or relief, according to a report by Cambridge University researchers. This is altering the behaviour of women and making them prone to attacks by wild animals, say experts.

Anushka-Virat's son Akaay not in viral video, says cricketer's sister amid buzzVirat Kohli's sister clarified that the child in a viral video presumed to be Anushka and Virat's son Akaay is their friend's daughter. The couple had welcomed Akaay earlier this year.

Yoda Diagnostics Launches 'Beat the Diabetes' Campaign to Raise Awareness and Promote Personalized Diabetes CareEmpowering Personalized Diabetes Care: Yoda Diagnostics' 'Beat the Diabetes' Campaign Promotes Genetic-Based Medication Plans
Nana Patole denies resigning as Maharashtra Congress chief: 'MVA is intact'Maharashtra Congress chief Nana Patole said that the Maha Vikas Aghadi aliance was still intact.

Mumbai local gets a cool upgrade: All trains to go fully AC soon!Say goodbye to sweaty rides and hello to breezy journeys! Mumbai's local trains are set to transform into the ultimate commuting experience. While this is exciting news, here are some interesting facts about Mumbai locals.
Earth's axis has tilted and India has a big role behind itThe study estimates that humans have pumped out around 2,150 gigatons of groundwater during the study period.

Who is Allah Ghazanfar? MI shell out 4.80 crore for Afghanistan mystery spinner IPL 2025 Auction: Allah Ghazanfar will play for the Mumbai Indians (MI) after being bought by the five-time champions for INR 4.80 crore. He was a part of KKR last season, but did not play a single match.

GRAP-IV pollution curbs to stay, tighter border checks needed: Supreme CourtThe court said that they would consider prosecution of the Delhi Police Commissioner for deploying police personnel at only 23 check points, instead of all.

Sambhal: Case against Samajwadi MP, Akhilesh Yadav says riot by Yogi governmentSambhal violence: Opposition parties blamed the BJP for inciting violence through a mosque survey, while the BJP accused the INDIA alliance of fomenting unrest since the Lok Sabha poll failure.

Actor Parvathy on why she stood by Nayanthara against Dhanush with 'salute' emojiActor Parvathy Thiruvothu supported Nayanthara by sharing her three-page open letter against Dhanush earlier this month. She now appreciated Nayanthara for being a self-made woman, and opened up on her decision to stand by her.
Earth's second moon will disappear todayThe object was first spotted in August 2024 and entered its semi-jog around Earth in late September.
Is Maharashtra on way to becoming Opposition-mukt just like Gujarat?The BJP's remarkable performance in the assembly elections allows it to finally dictate terms to one and all.

Ajit Pawar's power play, backs Devendra Fadnavis for Chief Minister: SourcesAjit Pawar convened a meeting with his newly-elected legislators at his residence on Sunday, where he discussed the next Chief Minister of Maharashtra.

Why the Indian mindset of hoarding and cluttering is a problemHow many things can you count on your fingers that serve no purpose, yet you still hold onto them? We all struggle with hoarding and cluttering, but it's crucial not to let this habit affect your mental well-being.

1st Test: Jasprit Bumrah's India breach Perth fortress, outclass hapless Australia Border-Gavaskar Trophy: India became the first team to beat Australia at Perth's Optus Stadium as the Jasprit Bumrah-led side secured a historic 295-run win in the first Test of the five-match series. This is India's largest-ever Test win in Australia.

A mandir-masjid dispute and a survey: What led to deadly Sambhal violenceSambhal Violence: The Hindu side cites historical texts and an ASI report to support their temple claim, while the Muslim side dismisses it, invoking the 1991 Supreme Court ruling preserving the status of religious sites as they were in 1947.

Sanjay Raut blames ex-Chief Justice Chandrachud for Maharashtra poll drubbingSanjay Raut's explosive remark comes after his earlier statement wherein he accused the Mahayuti alliance of "stealing" seats.

Actor Parvathy on why she stood by Nayanthara against Dhanush with 'salute' emojiActor Parvathy Thiruvothu supported Nayanthara by sharing her three-page open letter against Dhanush earlier this month. She now appreciated Nayanthara for being a self-made woman, and opened up on her decision to stand by her.

52nd International Emmys: When and where to watch the awards and other detailsThe 2024 International Emmy Awards will be held in New York on November 25. Hosted by actor-comedian Vir Das, the awards show will feature 56 nominees from 21 countries.
Shoojit Sircar opens up about I Want to Talk, casting Abhishek BachchanShoojit Sircar talks about his film, casting Abhishek Bachchan, and dealing with the loss of Irrfan Khan and his parents.

Kantara: Chapter 1 shoot goes as planned, no injury reported in bus accidentIt was earlier reported that a bus carrying 20 junior artistes from the Kantara sets met with an accident in Karnataka. However, a statement now clarified that none of the crew and cast members were injured, and the shooting would continue as per schedule.

sports.headline: Anshul Kamboj gets 3.40 crore deal after historic 10-wicket haul in Ranji TrophyHaryana pacer Anshul Kamboj was sold for INR 3.40 crore to Chennai Super Kings in the IPL 2025 mega auction.

India reclaim top spot in WTC 2023-25 points table after Perth Test winAUS vs IND: India went back to the top of the table in the WTC 2023-25 cyle after beating Pat Cummins' Australia by 295 runs at the Optus Stadium. The Aussies, meanwhile, fell to second.

Watch: Siraj recreates viral 'game-changer Jassi bhai' dialogue after Perth winAUS vs IND 1st Test: Mohammed Siraj recreated the viral "we only believe in Jassi bhai" dialogue after the Perth Test win. The BCCI shared a video of the same on social media.

Who is Allah Ghazanfar? MI shell out 4.80 crore for Afghanistan mystery spinner IPL 2025 Auction: Allah Ghazanfar will play for the Mumbai Indians (MI) after being bought by the five-time champions for INR 4.80 crore. He was a part of KKR last season, but did not play a single match.

Virat Kohli above Joe Root among Test batters: Former Australia head coachFormer Australia cricketer and head coach Darren Lehmann has rated Virat Kohli above Joe Root among Test batters after his magnificent century in Perth.

MI outbid CSK to buy injury-prone Deepak Chahar at Rs 9.25 croreIPL 2025 mega auction: After missing out on Bhuvneshwar Kumar, Mumbai Indians went all out for Deepak Chahar. They outbid Chennai Super Kings for Rs 9.25 crore.

IPL 2025 Auction: Bhuvneshwar Kumar gets 156 percent pay rise, heads to RCBBhuvneshwar Kumar hit the jackpot as he was bought by Royal Challengers Bengaluru for Rs. 10.75 crore during Day 2 of the IPL 2025 Auction on Monday, November 25.

Gerald Coetzee at steal price: GT buy to add to scary fast bowling attackIPL 2025 mega auction: Gerald Coetzee was sold at a steel price of Rs 2.40 crore to Gujarat Titans. The Titans continue to strengthen their pace bowling attack as they build a strong team in lead up to IPL.

Australia were clearly well off the mark, lot to work on: Pat Cummins on Perth defeatAUS vs IND, 1st Test: Pat Cummins said that Australia were not up to the mark in the Perth Test against India. Australia went 0-1 down in the five-match series after losing by 295 runs at the Optus Stadium. Cummins also talked about the challenge of making a comeback in the Day-Night Test at the Adelaide Oval.

IPL 2025 auction: Shardul Thakur, Kane Williamson, Glenn Phillips go unsoldThe Day 2 of the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2025 saw several big names of the cricketing fraternity going unsold such as Shardul Thakur, Ajinkya  Rahane, Prithvi Shaw,  Kane Williamson among others.

IPL Auction: RCB continue be RTM shy, miss Faf du Plessis at Rs 2 croreIPL mega auction Day 2: Despite having as many as three Right to Match cards, RCB passed the opportunity to buy Faf du Plessis. The South African star was sold to Delhi Capitals at his base price of Rs 2 crore.

Australia went 0-1 down in the five-match series after losing by 295 runs at the Optus Stadium. Cummins also talked about the challenge of making a comeback in the Day-Night Test at the Adelaide Oval.

IPL Auction: RCB continue be RTM shy, miss Faf du Plessis at Rs 2 croreIPL mega auction Day 2: Despite having as many as three Right to Match cards, RCB passed the opportunity to buy Faf du Plessis. The South African star was sold to Delhi Capitals at his base price of Rs 2 crore.

AUS vs IND: Pat Cummins backs Marnus Labuschagne to bounce back in Adelaide TestPat Cummins has backed Marnus Labuschagne to bounce back after his slump in form continued during the Perth Test of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy series. Labuschagne scored just 5 runs in the match.

Bumrah wants India to 'start from zero' in Adelaide after Perth Test winAUS vs IND, 1st Test: Jasprit Bumrah said that India were delighted after taking a 1–0 series win with a 295-run win at the Perth Stadium. But he also said that India need to start from scratch in the second Test, starting December 6 at the Adelaide Oval.
IPL 2025 mega auction: Prithvi Shaw unsold in 1st round after losing DC contractIndia batter Prithvi Shaw went unsold in the first round of the IPL 2025 mega auction.

Kaif reveals how Salt's inclusion in RCB prove beneficial for Virat KohliMohammed Kaif felt that Phil Salt's inclusion in the RCB lineup would prove to be beneficial. With Salt's explosive batting at the top of the order, Virat Kohli will get to play his anchor role.

Can I bring my girlfriend? Ravi Shastri recalls Kohli's flying kiss deja vu Ravi Shastri recalled an interesting anecdote from 2014 when Virat Kohli requested him to let Anushka Sharma come to the Australia tour.

Selfess Bumrah happy to step aside after 'captain' Rohit Sharma returnsAUS vs IND: Jasprit Bumrah welcomed back 'captain' Rohit Sharma to the Indian setup after India's massive win by 295 runs at the Perth Stadium. Rohit had his first training session on Monday before the Adelaide Test.

Australia afraid of Jasprit Bumrah? Pacer laughs off question after Perth victoryBorder-Gavaskar Trophy 2024: Jasprit Bumrah continued to haunt Australia, taking eight wickets in India's 295-run win in the Perth Test. The stand-in captain had a field day, answering some interesting questions from the press on Monday.

Kohli doesn't need us, we need him: Bumrah after Perth Test centuryIndia stand-in captain Jasprit Bumrah heaped praise on Virat Kohli, hailing his resilient century in the Perth Test as a crucial innings that helped India secure a commanding 295-run win and take a 1-0 lead in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.

Can I bring my girlfriend? Ravi Shastri recalls Kohli's flying kiss deja vu Ravi Shastri recalled an interesting anecdote from 2014 when Virat Kohli requested him to let Anushka Sharma come to the Australia tour.

Selfess Bumrah happy to step aside after 'captain' Rohit Sharma returnsAUS vs IND: Jasprit Bumrah welcomed back 'captain' Rohit Sharma to the Indian setup after India's massive win by 295 runs at the Perth Stadium. Rohit had his first training session on Monday before the Adelaide Test.

Pacer laughs off question after Perth victoryBorder-Gavaskar Trophy 2024: Jasprit Bumrah continued to haunt Australia, taking eight wickets in India's 295-run win in the Perth Test. The stand-in captain had a field day, answering some interesting questions from the press on Monday.

Kohli doesn't need us, we need him: Bumrah after Perth Test centuryIndia stand-in captain Jasprit Bumrah heaped praise on Virat Kohli, hailing his resilient century in the Perth Test as a crucial innings that helped India secure a commanding 295-run win and take a 1-0 lead in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.

Starc refutes batters vs bowlers rift in Australian dressing room after Perth lossAustralia pacer Mitchell Starc refuted reports of a batters vs bowlers rift in the Australian dressing room after the Perth loss to India in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.

Excuse me, Cummins: AUS captain forgets presentation during chat with BumrahAUS vs IND: Australia captain Pat Cummins hilariously forgot about the presentation ceremony after the conclusion of the Perth Test match. Cummins needed multiple reminders from presenter Adam Gilchrist before he came up on the dias.

Bumrah's historic feat, India's biggest win in Australia: Stat PackAUS vs IND: Jasprit Bumrah's India took a 1-0 lead in the five-match series after beating Pat Cummins' Australia by 295 runs at the Optus Stadium. Bumrah became the Player of the Match for taking eight wickets, including a five-wicket haul in the first innings.

Perth Pitch was not that spicy: Jasprit Bumrah bullish after record win vs AUSAUS vs IND 1st Test: Jasprit Bumrah said that the current pitch was a bit less spicy than the one on which the Indian team played in 2018.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
